page.title: 13IRON AGE FARM BUTSER
page.content: The main building is a Round House reconstructed exactly according to excavated ground plans.It is 26' high and 42'in diameter.Over 200 trees were used in its construction,4 tonnes of straw thatch the roof and 10 tonnes of daub was plastered to the wattle framed walls.A ditch and bank surround the house to keep out animals.Several byres give shelter to goats and hens. A series of kilns show the various ways in which pottery was fired. A small area is given over to smelting and melting of ores and metals. Cylindrical pits in the ground are used for grain and food storage and there are 2 grain driers on the site. Haystacks constructed round a post and platform provides winter feed for the animals.Upright stakes interwoven with hazel and ash poles form the fencing around the site.
